name: select
description: Inspect Select, Multiple-Select and TimeZone fields

fields.data:
Select field Properties:
⦿help - explain input pattern and purpose. can be displayed on ❔ button click
⦿default - value on initial display
⦿readonly - disable input from the user
⦿required - when set to ture, input must be provided (empty string is not allowed)
⦿allowCreate - indicating whether the user is allowed to add options to the list
fields.name: select_info_msg

fields.help: Select one value from the list
fields.name: select_select1

fields.help: Select one value from the list or leave it empty
fields.name: select_select2

fields.help: Addable drop-down list , i.e. except the default options - 'Option1', 'Option2' and 'Option3', user input can be added as additional options
fields.name: select_select3

fields.help: Predefined, readonly field, with the value of Option4
fields.name: select_select4
select_json
fields.default:
{
  "default": "Option1",
  "display": "Select (mandatory)",
  "help": "Select one value from the list",
  "name": "select_select1",
  "required": true,
  "type": "select",
  "values": ["Option1", "Option2", "Option3", "Option4", "Option5"]
},
{
  "default": "",
  "display": "Select (not mandatory)",
  "help": "Select one value from the list or leave it empty",
  "name": "select_select2",
  "required": false,
  "type": "select",
  "values": ["Option1", "Option2", "Option3", "Option4", "Option5"]
},
{
  "default": "Option3",
  "display": "Addable Select",
  "help": "Addable drop-down list , i.e. except the default options - 'Option1', 'Option2' and 'Option3', user input can be added as additional options",
  "name": "select_select3",
  "allowCreate": true,
  "type": "select",
  "values": ["Option1", "Option2", "Option3"]
},
{
  "default": "Option4",
  "display": "Readonly Select",
  "help": "Predefined, readonly field, with the value of Option4",
  "name": "select_select4",
  "required": false,
  "readonly": true,
  "type": "select",
  "values": ["Option1", "Option2", "Option3", "Option4", "Option5"]
}
